ЁЯСС
Independent Sovereignty

After the death of Harshavardhana (647 CE), anarchy spread in North India. Adityasena took advantage of this opportunity, declared independent sovereignty in Magadha, and assumed the title 'Maharajadhiraja'.

ЁЯФе
Ashvamedha Sacrifice

He was one of the last great rulers in the history of ancient India to authentically perform the Ashvamedha sacrifice.

ЁЯПЫя╕П
Construction

He built a Vishnu temple in Gaya. During his time, Chinese travelers Hiuen Tsang (second visit) and I-tsing visited India.

ЁЯУМ
Important Facts (Exam Points)
  • Shahpur Stone Inscription: Mentions Adityasena.
  • Marital Relations: His daughter married Bhogavarman of the Maukhari dynasty, and his granddaughter married Shivadeva II, the king of Nepal.
